member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta._firstFrame
member.summary: first audio frame; could be could be xing or vbri header

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta._id3DurationTag
member.summary: duration of the audio block, as parsed from the optional ID3v2 "TLEN" tag the Xing/VBRI header is more authoritative for bitrate calculations, if present.

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta._audioStats
member.summary: number of frames and audio bytes - obtained by counting the entire file - slow!

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta._hasInconsistencies
member.summary: flag that is set on parse error. This might turn into an enum for different errors at some point

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta._sourceFileInfo
member.summary: holds audio stream filename; opened afresh when we need the data

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta._payloadStart
member.summary: offset from start of stream that the audio starts at

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta._payloadNumBytes
member.summary: total length (bytes) of mp3 audio frames in the file, could be different from what's declared in the header if the file is corrupt.

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.#ctor(System.IO.FileInfo,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: construct audio file passing in audio size and id3 length tag (if any) to help with bitrate calculations

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.OpenAudioStream
member.summary: the stream containing the audio data, wound to the start
member.remarks: it is the caller's responsibility to dispose of the returned stream and to call NumPayloadBytes to know how many bytes to read.

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.CalculateAudioSHA1
member.summary: calculate sha-1 of the audio data

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.ScanWholeFile
member.summary: Count frames and bytes of file to see who's telling porkies

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.DebugString
member.summary: text info, e.g. the encoding standard of audio data in AudioStream ///

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.NumPayloadBytes
member.summary: the number of bytes of data in AudioStream, always the real size of the file

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.Header
member.summary: the mp3 frame header number of bytes of audio data in AudioStream

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.IsVbr
member.summary: is it a VBR file? i.e. is it better encoding quality than cbr at the same bitrate? first we make a guess based on the audio header found in the first frame.
member.remarks: if the frame didn't have any strong opinions, we don't check if the mp3 audio header bitrate is the same as the calculated bitrate because a truncated file shows up as vbr (because the bitrates don't match) and we just return false.

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.HasVbrHeader
member.summary: does it have a VBR (VBRI, XING, INFO, LAME) header?

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.NumAudioBytes
member.summary: Number of bytes playable audio, VBR header priority, best for calculating bitrates

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.NumPayloadFrames
member.summary: Number of Frames in file (including the header frame) VBR header priority, best for calculating bitrates or if not present, calculated from the number of bytes in the audio block, as reported by the caller This will be correct for CBR files, at least.

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.NumAudioFrames
member.summary: Number of Frames of playable audio

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.Duration
member.summary: Number of seconds for bitrate calculations. first get it from the xing/vbri headers, then from the id3 TLEN tag, then from the file size and initial frame bitrate.

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.BitRateCalc
member.summary: bitrate calculated from the id3 length tag, and the length of the audio

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.BitRateMp3
member.summary: bitrate published in the standard mp3 header

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.BitRateVbr
member.summary: vbr bitrate from xing or vbri header frame audio without xing or vbri header returns null

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.BitRate
member.summary: overall best guess of bitrate; there's always a way of guessing it

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.HasInconsistencies
member.summary: did it parse without any errors?

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Meta.ParsingError
member.summary: get the error from the parse operation, if any
member.remarks: should the parse operation save all thrown exceptions here, and not generate it on demand?

member.name: T:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame
member.summary: Read mp3 frame
member.remarks: additional info: http://www.codeproject.com/KB/audio-video/mpegaudioinfo.aspx

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame._frameBuffer
member.summary: byte array containing entire raw frame data correct size, even for free bitrate files

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame._header
member.summary: MP3FrameHeader to work out how big the frame is

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame._headerBytes
member.summary: size of mp3 standard header; offset to xing or vbri header (if present)

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.Header
member.summary: MP3FrameHeader has all sorts of info about a frame of raw mp3 audio

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.FrameLengthInBytes
member.summary: get stored frame length
member.remarks: obtained from header, or distance between frames, at construction time.

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.DebugString
member.summary: text info, e.g. the encoding standard of audio data in AudioStream

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.IsVbr
member.summary: is it a VBR file? all we can do here is check the bitrate is not 'free' (which would imply CBR) then FrameVbriHeader/FrameXingHeader can override it.

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.NumPayloadBytes
member.summary: Number of Bytes in file (including this header frame) if VBR header not present, we can't know, so return null.

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.NumAudioBytes
member.summary: Number of bytes playable audio if VBR header not present, we can't know, so return null.

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.NumPayloadFrames
member.summary: Number of Frames in file if VBR header not present, we can't know, so return null.

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.NumAudioFrames
member.summary: Number of Frames of playable audio if VBR header not present, we can't know, so return null.

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.Duration
member.summary: Number of seconds of playable audio if VBR header not present, we can't know, so return null. xing/vbri headers would overload this if they have better information

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.BitRateMp3
member.summary: bitrate published in the standard mp3 header null for 'free' bitrate

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.BitRateVbr
member.summary: vbr bitrate from xing or vbri header frame audio frame without xing or vbri header returns null

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: construct AudioFrame from supplied bytes
member.remarks: buffer is correct size, even for free bitrate files

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: construct AudioFrame from a larger portion of the stream; don't rewind stream when done
member.param: size from header, or scanning for second frame of free bitrate file
number of bytes in audio block, as reported by the caller

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.#ctor(libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame)
member.summary: copy construct AudioFrame for derived classes

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.IsXingHeader
member.summary: does this frame contain the 'Xing' or 'Info' markers that make it a Xing VBR header?

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.IsLameHeader
member.summary: does this frame contain the 'Xing' or 'Info' markers that make it a Xing VBR header, then the LAME marker a bit further along?

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.IsVbriHeader
member.summary: does this frame contain the 'VBRI' marker that make it a fraunhofer VBR header?

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.ParseBigEndianWORD(System.Byte[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: read 2 bytes as big-endian unsigned int from buffer

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame.ParseBigEndianDWORD(System.Byte[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: read 4 bytes as big-endian unsigned int from buffer

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameFactory.CreateFrame(System.IO.Stream,System.UInt32)
member.summary: seek and create derived type of AudioFrame from stream
member.param: source stream, advanced by length of the frame on read
number of bytes in audio block, as reported by the caller
member.returns: wrapper for derived type of AudioFrame

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameFactory.CreateFrame(System.Byte[])
member.summary: create derived type of AudioFrame from buffer, or throw
member.returns: wrapper for derived type of AudioFrame

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameFactory.GetNextFrameOffset(System.IO.Stream,System.UInt32)
member.summary: skip to start of next frame
member.returns: number of bytes skipped, not length of frame found!

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameFactory.CreateHeader(System.IO.Stream,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates Header
member.remarks: n.b. doesn't rewind the stream to the start of the frame. If the caller wants to read the entire frame in one block, they'll have to rewind it themselves.

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameFactory.Seek(System.IO.Stream,System.Int64)
member.summary: Find the first occurrence of an mp3 header.
member.param: The stream to perform the search on.
member.returns: number of bytes skipped; stream is at first mp3 header position.

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameFactory.ReadHeader(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: parse frame header, or throw.

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3VbriFrame.DebugString
member.summary: some text to show we decoded it correctly

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3VbriFrame.IsVbr
member.summary: is it a VBR file? I don't think the presence of a VBRI header necessarily implies a VBR file and the absence of a VBR header doesn't imply it's not VBR either, but it's a good indicator, so that's the best assumption here

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3VbriFrame.NumPayloadBytes
member.summary: Number of Bytes in file (including this header frame) (always present in VBRI header)

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3VbriFrame.NumAudioBytes
member.summary: Number of bytes playable audio (i.e. excluding this header frame, but including the standard header bytes of normal audio frames))

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3VbriFrame.NumPayloadFrames
member.summary: Number of Frames in file (including this header frame) or if not present, calculated from the number of bytes in the audio block, as reported by the caller

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3VbriFrame.NumAudioFrames
member.summary: Number of Frames of playable audio (i.e. excluding any header frame)

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3VbriFrame.Duration
member.summary: Number of seconds from the id3 TLEN tag vbri header *always* has better information

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3VbriFrame.BitRateVbr
member.summary: vbr bitrate from vbri header frame

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3VbriFrame.#ctor(libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame)
member.summary: construct XingHeader frame from a pre-existing raw frame; "downcast".

member.name: T:libMedia.Mp3.mp3XingFrame.FieldsCode
member.summary: Flags which indicate what fields are present, flags are combined with a logical OR. Field is mandatory.

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3XingFrame.FieldsCode.Frames
member.summary: Frames field is present

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3XingFrame.FieldsCode.Bytes
member.summary: Bytes field is present

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3XingFrame.FieldsCode.Toc
member.summary: TOC field is present

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3XingFrame.FieldsCode.Quality
member.summary: Quality indicator field is present

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3XingFrame.DebugString
member.summary: some text to show we decoded it correctly

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3XingFrame.IsVbr
member.summary: is it a VBR file? A file with a 'Xing' header is VBR, an 'Info' header is CBR

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3XingFrame.NumPayloadBytes
member.summary: Number of Bytes in file (including this header frame) (optional) or if not present, the number of bytes in audio block, as reported by the caller

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3XingFrame.NumAudioBytes
member.summary: Number of bytes playable audio (i.e. excluding this header frame, but including the standard header bytes of normal audio frames))

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3XingFrame.NumPayloadFrames
member.summary: Number of Frames in file (including this header frame) or if not present, null

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3XingFrame.NumAudioFrames
member.summary: Number of Frames of playable audio (i.e. excluding this header frame)

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3XingFrame.Duration
member.summary: Number of seconds from xing header if not present, then the id3 TLEN tag

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3XingFrame.BitRateVbr
member.summary: vbr bitrate from xing header frame returns null where xing header doesn't have both frames and bytes

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.mp3XingFrame.#ctor(libMedia.Mp3.mp3Frame)
member.summary: construct XingHeader frame from a pre-existing raw frame; "downcast".

member.name: T:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader
member.summary: Read mp3 frame header
member.remarks: additional info: http://www.codeproject.com/KB/audio-video/mpegaudioinfo.aspx

member.name: T:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.ChannelModeCode
member.summary: stereo mode options

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.ChannelModeCode.Stereo
member.summary: 00 - full stereo (2 indepentent channels)

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.ChannelModeCode.JointStereo
member.summary: 01 - joint stereo (stereo encoded as sum + difference)

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.ChannelModeCode.DualMono
member.summary: 10 - two independent soundtracks (e.g. 2 languages)

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.ChannelModeCode.Mono
member.summary: 11 - just one channel

member.name: T:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.EmphasisCode
member.summary: emphasis options

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.EmphasisCode.None
member.summary: 00 - none

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.EmphasisCode.Reserved
member.summary: 10 - reserved

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.EmphasisCode.CCIT
member.summary: 11 - CCIT J.17

member.name: F:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader._headerBuffer
member.summary: byte array containing at least 4 bytes of raw frame data

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.Valid
member.summary: Simple validity check to verify all header fields are in legal ranges

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.VersionLayer
member.summary: mpeg version and layer

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.Layer
member.summary: mpeg layer

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.BitRate
member.summary: bitrate for this frame 0 for "free", i.e. free format. The free bitrate must remain constant, and must be lower than the maximum allowed bitrate. VBR encoders usually select a different one of the standard bitrates for each frame.

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.SamplesPerSecond
member.summary: samples per second; same for every frame

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.SamplesPerFrame
member.summary: samples per frame; same for every frame

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.SecondsPerFrame
member.summary: seconds per frame; same for every frame e.g. 384 Samples/Frame / 44100 Samples/Second = 8.7mS each

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.IsFreeBitRate
member.summary: is it a "free" bitrate file?
member.remarks: most frames know how big they are, but free bitrate files can only know their frame length at the file level.

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.PaddingSize
member.summary: padding size; different for every frame
member.remarks: Padding is used to exactly fit the bitrate. As an example: 128kbps 44.1kHz layer II uses a lot of 418 bytes and some of 417 bytes long frames to get the exact 128k bitrate. For Layer I slot is 32 bits (4 bytes) long For Layer II and Layer III slot is 8 bits (1 byte) long.

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.FrameLengthInBytes
member.summary: length of this frame in bytes; different for every frame bitrate calculation includes the standard header bytes of normal audio frames already returns null for 'free' bitrate files because parsing the audio coefficients to work out how long it should be is too much work. If you want to know how long the frame is, ask the audio stream, not the header.

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.IdealisedFrameLengthInBytes
member.summary: 'ideal' length of a frame at this bitrate; returns double, disregards padding. returns null for 'free' bitrate files because parsing the audio coefficients to work out how long it should be is too much work. If you want to know how long the frame should be, ask the audio stream, not the header.

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.ChecksumSize
member.summary: checksum size Protection = 0 - Protected by CRC (16bit crc follows header), 1 - Not protected

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.SideInfoSize
member.summary: channel config block size; different for every frame

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.HeaderSize
member.summary: size of standard header NB not all these bytes will have been read in

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.CRCs
member.summary: Checksum

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.Copyright
member.summary: Copyright

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.Original
member.summary: Original

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.Private
member.summary: Private

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.IsMono
member.summary: mono; must be same for every frame

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.ChannelMode
member.summary: stereo mode; different for every frame

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.Emphasis
member.summary: emphasis; different for every frame

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.mp3FrameHeader.DebugString
member.summary: some text to show we decoded it correctly

member.summary: construct MP3FrameHeader from 4 supplied bytes

member.summary: compare headers

member.summary: the number of bytes of data in the Audio payload always the real size of the file

member.summary: Number of bytes playable audio VBR header priority, best for calculating bitrates

member.summary: name of source file

member.summary: Current MP3Audio object - if re-assigned, owned by assigner.

member.summary: set to true if the audio is replaced

member.summary: offset from start of original stream that the original audio started at

member.summary: ID3v2 tag model at start of file

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.Mp3File.#ctor(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Construct from file info; parse ID3 tags from stream and calculate where the audio must be

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.Mp3File.Mp3Meta
member.summary: wrapper for the object containing the audio payload

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.Mp3File.TagModel
member.summary: ID3v2 tags represented by the Frame Model

member.name: P:libMedia.Mp3.Mp3File.TagHandler
member.summary: ID3v2 tags wrapped in an interpreter that gives you real properties for each supported frame

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.Mp3File.Update
member.summary: Update ID3V2 and V1 tags in-situ if possible, or rewrite the file to add tags if necessary.
member.returns: bool true if the MP3FileData object is dirty after this

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.Mp3File.UpdatePacked
member.summary: rewrite the file and ID3V2 and V1 tags with no padding.
member.returns: bool true if the MP3FileData object is dirty after this

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.Mp3File.UpdateNoV2tag
member.summary: Update file and remove ID3V2 tag (if any); update file in-situ if possible, or rewrite the file to remove tag if necessary.
member.returns: bool true if the MP3FileData object is unusable after this

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.Mp3File.UpdateInSitu(System.UInt32)
member.summary: UpdateInSitu
member.remarks: doesn't make a backup as it's only modifying the tags not re-writing the audio

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.Mp3File.RewriteFile(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: create new output file stream and write the ID3v2 block to it
member.remarks: makes a backup as it's modifying the tags and re-writing the audio. Always need to re-initialise the mp3 file wrapper if you use it after this runs
member.param: location of backup file - must be on same drive

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.Mp3File.UpdateInSituNoV2tag
member.summary: UpdateInSituNoV2tag
member.remarks: doesn't make a backup as it's only modifying the tags not re-writing the audio

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.Mp3File.RewriteFileNoV2tag(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: create new output file stream and don't write the ID3v2 block to it
member.remarks: makes a backup as it's re-writing the audio Always need to re-initialise the mp3 file wrapper if you use it after this runs
member.param: location of backup file - must be on same drive

member.name: M:libMedia.Mp3.Mp3File.WriteID3v1(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: append or overwrite ID3v1 tag at the end of the audio

member.name: T:libMedia.ID3.Exceptions.InvalidFrameException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when a frame is corrupt.

member.name: T:libMedia.ID3.Exceptions.InvalidPaddingException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the amount of padding doesn't match the space left over at the end of the ID3V2 tag.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.Exceptions.InvalidPaddingException.Measured
member.summary: the number of zero bytes actually found between the last frame in the id3v2 tag, and the first non-zero byte of audio.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.Exceptions.InvalidPaddingException.Specified
member.summary: the amount of space between the last frame in the id3v2 tag, and the specified end of the tag block.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.Exceptions.InvalidPaddingException.Message
member.summary: overrides default message with a specific "Padding is corrupt" one

member.name: T:libMedia.ID3.Exceptions.InvalidStructureException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when some component of an mp3 file is permanently corrupt. Re-reading the file will always give you the same error, as opposed to I/O or permission errors that can be usefully retried.
member.remarks: "Exceptions should be marked [Serializable]" http://www.codeproject.com/KB/architecture/exceptionbestpractices.aspx#Exceptionsshouldbemarked[Serializable]22

member.name: T:libMedia.ID3.Exceptions.InvalidTagException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the tag is corrupt.

member.name: T:libMedia.ID3.Exceptions.TagNotFoundException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the tag is missing.

member.name: T:libMedia.ID3.FrameDescription
member.summary: Helper class to get a description of the frame identifiers.

member.summary: Manage the Parsing or Creation of binary frames.
member.remarks: The FrameHelper is a helper class that receives binary frame from a ID3v1 tag and returns the correct parsed frame or form a frame creates a binary frame that can be saved on an ID3v2 tag in a mp3 file.

member.name: T:libMedia.ID3.Frames.FrameBase
member.summary: Abstract base frame that provides common functionality to all the frames.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.Frames.FrameBase.TagAlter
member.summary: Get or set the tag alter flag
member.remarks: This flag tells the tag parser what to do with this frame if it is unknown and the tag is altered in any way. the frames.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.Frames.FrameBase.FileAlter
member.summary: Get or set the file alter flag
member.remarks: This flag tells the tag parser what to do with this frame if it is unknown and the file, excluding the tag, is altered.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.Frames.FrameBase.ReadOnly
member.summary: Get or set the read only flag
member.remarks: This flag, if set, tells the software that the contents of this frame are intended to be read only.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.Frames.FrameBase.Compression
member.summary: Get or set the compression flag.
member.remarks: This flag indicates whether or not the frame is compressed.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.Frames.FrameBase.Encryption
member.summary: Get or set the encryption flag.
member.remarks: This flag indicates whether or not the frame is encrypted.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.Frames.FrameBase.Unsynchronisation
member.summary: Get or set the un-synchronisation flag.
member.remarks: This flag indicates whether or not un-synchronisation was applied to this frame.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.Frames.FrameBase.DataLength
member.summary: Get or set the data length.
member.remarks: This flag indicates that a data length indicator has been added to the frame.

member.name: T:libMedia.ID3.Frames.FrameText
member.summary: Manages Text frames
member.remarks:
The FrameText class handles the frames of text information these are often the most important frames, containing information like artist, album and more. There may only be one text information frame of its kind in an tag.
Text encoding $xx Information text string(s) according to encoding

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.TagHandler.Disc
member.summary: Get the disc number.
member.remarks: The 'Part of a set' frame is a numeric string that describes which part of a set the audio came from. This frame is used if the source described in the "TALB" frame is divided into several mediums, e.g. a double CD. The value MAY be extended with a "/" character and a numeric string containing the total number of parts in the set. E.g. "1/2".

member.summary: Get the length. the length of the audio file in milliseconds, represented as a numeric string.

member.name: T:libMedia.ID3.TagHeader
member.summary: Manages the ID3v2 tag header.
member.remarks: The Header class manages the first part of the ID3v2 tag that is the first ten bytes of the ID3v1 tag.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.TagHeader.HeaderSize
member.summary: Get the size of the header only.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.TagHeader.Version
member.summary: Get or set ID3v2 major version number.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.TagHeader.Revision
member.summary: Get or set the ID3v2 revision number.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.TagHeader.TagSize
member.summary: Get or set the ID3v2 frames size, i.e. the tag excluding header and footer.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.TagHeader.TagSizeWithHeaderFooter
member.summary: Get the minimum complete ID3v2 tag size, including header and footer but not including any padding.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.TagHeader.Unsync
member.summary: Get or set if un-synchronisation is applied on all frames.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.TagHeader.ExtendedHeader
member.summary: Get or set if the header is followed by an extended header.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.TagHeader.Experimental
member.summary: Get or set if the tag is experimental stage.
member.remarks: This flag shall always be set when the tag is in an experimental stage.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.TagHeader.Footer
member.summary: Get or set if a footer is present at the end of the tag.
member.remarks: Can't be used simultaneously with the frame padding they are mutually exclusive.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.TagHeader.Padding
member.summary: Get if padding is applied on the tag.
member.remarks: Can't be used simultaneously with the frame footer they are mutually exclusive.

member.name: P:libMedia.ID3.TagHeader.PaddingSize
member.summary: Get or set the padding size, and thus padding.

member.summary: Load header from the stream.

member.remarks: The FrameModel class represents a ID3v2 tag, it contains a that handles the tag header, an that it is optional and stores the frames.

member.name: M:libMedia.ID3.TagModel.UpdateSize
member.summary: predict the size of the frames on disk (without any padding) by streaming the tag to a dummy stream, which updates the stored size.
member.remarks: Although the the padding is streamed out, the size isn't added on to Header.TagSize

member.name: T:libMedia.ID3.Utils.Sync
member.summary: Provides static methods for making ID3v2 un-synchronisation
member.remarks:
This helper class takes care of the synchronisation and un-synchronisation needs. The purpose of un-synchronisation is to make the ID3v2 tag as compatible as possible with existing software and hardware.
Synch safe integers are integers that keep its highest byte bit (bit 7) zeroed, making seven bits out of every eight available.

member.name: M:libMedia.ID3.Utils.Sync.Unsafe(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Converts from a sync-safe integer to a normal integer

member.name: M:libMedia.ID3.Utils.Sync.Safe(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Converts from a normal integer to a sync-safe integer

member.name: M:libMedia.ID3.Utils.Sync.UnsafeBigEndian(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Converts from a sync-safe integer to a normal integer

member.name: M:libMedia.ID3.Utils.Sync.SafeBigEndian(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Converts from a sync-safe integer to a normal integer

member.summary: Convert a sync-safe stream to a normal stream
member.returns: Number of bytes removed from the original stream

member.name: M:libMedia.ID3.Utils.Sync.Safe(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.UInt32)

member.returns: Number of bytes added to the original stream

member.name: T:libMedia.InvalidFrameException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when an audio frame is corrupt.

member.name: T:libMedia.InvalidVbrSizeException
member.summary: The exception is for when the vbr header claims the audio is a different length to the file size. This can happen if the file has been truncated at some point in its history, but could also be if unrecognised tags (non-id3, e.g. monkey audio) are added to the file. It is not thrown as such, because it's not an error that needs the parse to fail.

member.name: P:libMedia.InvalidVbrSizeException.Measured
member.summary: the number of zero bytes found after the last frame in the id3v2 tag

member.name: P:libMedia.InvalidVbrSizeException.Specified
member.summary: the amount of space left over after the last frame in the id3v2 tag

member.name: P:libMedia.InvalidVbrSizeException.Message
member.summary: overrides default message with a specific "Padding is corrupt" one

member.name: T:Utils.FileMover
member.summary: Provides FileMove function to wrap System.IO.File.Replace

member.name: M:Utils.FileMover.FileMove(System.IO.FileInfo,System.IO.FileInfo,System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Securely moves a file to a new location. Overwrites any preexisting file at new location (= replacing file).
member.remarks: If NTFS is available this is done via File.Replace. If NTFS is not available it will be moved via deleting any preexisting file and moving. Do NOT rely on the backupFile being there - or not - after the move process. That is not predetermined. This method is clearly optimized for the case that NTFS is available. Consider NOT using it on any other filesystem, if performance is an issue!
member.param: The new resting place of the file.
A backup location that is used when replacing.
